intro: Phacelia dociana, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue or purple flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in mountainous regions. Phacelia dociana plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
